sections.Part 1:
Conan unsuccessfully tries to convince Haibara to give him a couple antidotes in order to go to the Kyoto trip with Ran as a high schooler. Suddenly, Haibara finds out she lost the Higo puppet phone strap she bought at the stadium store. It was particularly precious to her because Ryusuke Higo touched it in the bleachers during the football match. She freezes in disbelief and collapses against the wall.

Conan makes a deal with Haibara: he'll go and with the Detective Boys to find her phone strap, in exchange for the antidotes. Conan and the Boys are helped by Amuro and rush to the train stations' lost and found, all while being spied on by a strange man.
sections.Part 2: They successfully locate the the boy and his father at the beach. The two are glad to have the situation resolved and take out the Higo phone strap to give to Conan. Suddenly, the mysterious man appears and swipes it out of his hand.
sections.People:
- Boy from the train
- Elementary school 1st grade student
- Man from the train
- Yuto's father
- Follows the Detective Boys
- Restaurant Danny's dining clerk
- Shinjuku Line Chiyari train station employee
sections.Resolution:
- Real identity of the mysterious man
- Disguised as a clam digger
The man asks Conan who he is, but he simply tells him that he can stop playing dumb. Conan fist explains that the man could change his flat cap and jacket at the beach store, but there was no way of changing out of his pants without going to the changing room. The man tries to explain himself by saying that he's changing so he can go clam digging, but Conan rebuts that it's late in the afternoon; everyone is beginning to leave and it's too late to start. Conan then points out the price tag attached to is hat which, proving that he had just bought and put on the hat. Conan finishes by saying that the strap is sticking out from his bag. The man then checks and smugly replies that it is fully hidden in the bag, ultimately exposing himself. The man tries to escape but Conan knocks him out with his soccer ball. Amuro comments on Conan's Power Enhancing Kick Shoes.
sections.Trivia:
- Cars parked in Danny's parking are:
- Lime green Suzuki swift. License plate: 新宿 530, も 29-40 (Shinjuku 530, Mo 29-40).
- Pastel pink Nissan Cube new generation. License plate not visible.
- Restaurant Danny's Dining reappers, but this time in another of its locations.
- Different souvernir phone straps dedicated to Big Osaka players have other players' phone strap:
- Murakami (村上)
- Ue (宇江)
- Nakahara (中原)
- Miyamoto (宮元)
- Tono (戸尾)
- Watanabe (渡辺)
- In The Mysterious Old Man Disappearance Case, Conan did what Amuro told Kazami to do in this case.
- Yuto Yoshida (吉田 佑斗)'s name comes from Yuri Yoshida (吉田 有里) and Yuto Adachi (安達 佑斗), editors at Shonen Sunday. The first name Yuto is also a reference to the manga about football Shoot! (シュート! ,Shūto?).[1]
- Chiyari Station (千槍駅) comes from Charing Cross Station (チャリング・クロス駅 ,Charingu Kurosu-eki?) in London.[1]
sections.Manga to anime changes: - Unlike the manga, which described the background behind why the mysterious man really stole the strap, the anime only explained it briefly.
